puzzles.name: The Manifesto
puzzles.clue: In 1995, a manifesto appeared in newspapers. Find where it first published online.
puzzles.hint: The Washington Post was one of the first to publish it digitally...
hints: The manifesto was written by someone who rejected modern technology...
It was published in major newspapers like The Washington Post and New York Times.

puzzles.name: The Cipher Machine
puzzles.clue: Before computers, there were wheels within wheels. Find the machine that cracked the impossible.
hints: This machine was used to encrypt German military communications in WWII.
A brilliant mathematician at Bletchley Park helped decode it.
puzzles.target_description: Enigma machine decryption Bletchley Park Alan Turing

puzzles.name: The Archive
puzzles.clue: The ghost once lived in a place where 140 characters ruled. Now it's 280, but the old archives remain.
hints: There's a 'wayback' to see old versions of websites...
The Internet Archive preserves the web's history.
Visit archive.org and search for old Twitter pages
puzzles.target_description: Twitter Internet Archive Wayback Machine history
